info.game_comments: (Sarah [accompanied by Jimmy]: Jaws clues coming up on Jeopardy! next... I hope!)

(1, 1).clue: In 2003 he said he had completed the last 3 volumes of his "Dark Tower" series & had revised the first volume

(2, 1).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew)  After going months over schedule here at Martha's Vineyard, he feared he might never direct another movie

(3, 1).clue: Eating some locally-produced raw honey daily can provide you with some relief from allergies related to this

(5, 1).clue: Time's 1980 Man of the Year cover showed him in a western shirt, jeans & a tooled belt with silver buckle

(6, 1).clue: Slang for a guy from Sydney

(1, 2).clue: A werebeaver turns up in Thomas Pynchon's 1997 novel on this famous pair of surveyors

(2, 2).clue: (Sarah) His "Jaws" score includes "Out to Sea", "Promenade Tourists on the Menu", and, of course, the main title theme

(3, 2).clue: The queen bee can do this once every 30 seconds, over 1,500 times a day

(5, 2).clue: To get into this event at the White House March 31, 1997 you had to have a 3-to-6-year-old kid with you

(6, 2).clue: A fighter pilot has to shoot down 5 or more enemy aircraft to earn this nickname

(1, 3).clue: He was all at sea with 1951's "The Caine Mutiny" & back on board 20 years later with "The Winds of War"

(2, 3).clue: (Cheryl) He played police chief Martin Brody in both "Jaws" & the first sequel

(3, 3).clue: Honey's not your only product; you can make candles & furniture polish out of this

(5, 3).clue: In 1992 United began flying the Latin American routes purchased from this airline that folded in 1991

(1, 4).clue: "O'Hara's Choice" is the final novel by this author who made his own exodus from this world in 2003

(2, 4).clue: (Sarah) This author partly based "Jaws" on life in Nantucket, but had never set foot here on Martha's Vineyard until filming

(3, 4).clue: The only job this bee has is to mate with the queen & while you think "Hot Job!" remember they die after mating

(5, 4).clue: This brand's jingle called it "That Heavenly Coffee"

(6, 4).clue: Usually built on a cliff or other high place, it's an eagle's home

(1, 5).clue: In "Dodsworth" by Sinclair Lewis, Sam Dodsworth is president of a car co. in this town that was "at its peak"

(2, 5).clue: (Sarah) It completes one of the most famous lines spoken in "Jaws": "You're gonna need..."

(3, 5).clue: Of the 3 main parts of a bee's body, the section that secretes the royal jelly

(5, 5).clue: In 1996 Chevy reintroduced this model first seen in 1964, also the name of a version of Barbie

(6, 5).clue: The special mood or atmosphere created by a particular environment

(1, 1).clue: It's the holiest & third-longest river in India

(2, 1).clue: In 2003 Mike Weir became the first Canadian golfer to win this major tournament & wear the fabled green jacket

(3, 1).clue: This explorer first reached the mainland of the Americas on the coast of Venezuela in 1498

(4, 1).clue: The black type of this hard-to-find edible fungus grows in the French region of Perigord

(5, 1).clue: This Nigerian-born basketball star was a "Dream" come true in Houston

(6, 1).clue: Programs carried on this cable channel include "The Crocodile Hunter" & "Emergency Vets"

(1, 2).clue: India shares its longest border with this nation to the west

(2, 2).clue: On July 27, 1996 Donovan Bailey set an Olympic & world record in this track event at 9.84 seconds

(3, 2).clue: In 1813 he was given the title of liberator after his army captured Caracas

(4, 2).clue: This French sauce made with butter, egg yolks & lemon juice is named for another country

(5, 2).clue: Current president Obasanjo & this largest Nigerian city are both of Yoruba origin

(6, 2).clue: This 1970 sequel continued its predecessor's distant future scenario about intelligent apes & docile humans
(6, 2).correct response: Beneath the Planet of the Apes

(1, 3).clue: This planned city was inaugurated as the capital of India in 1931

(2, 3).clue: Only 2 Pittsburgh Penguin players have led the NHL in scoring: Jaromir Jagr & this man who's done it 6 times

(3, 3).clue: In 1960 Venezuela & 4 other nations including Kuwait & Saudi Arabia founded this organization

(4, 3).clue: This specialty of Alsace is the enlarged liver of a goose or duck

(5, 3).clue: Before president, it was the main job of 1990s presidents Babangida, Abacha & Abubakar

(6, 3).clue: This restaurant in which Arnold Schwarzenegger was an investor has locations from Acapulco to Auckland

(1, 4).clue: The most populous city in India, it's also the nation's financial & filmmaking capital

(2, 4).clue: He's not the king of rock & roll, but he was the king of men's figure skating in 1994 & 1995, winning the world title

(3, 4).clue: It drops 3,212 feet from a mesa in the Guiana highlands & was discovered from the air in 1935

(4, 4).clue: This 6-letter term indicates that a dish is sprinkled with liquor & ignited for a dramatic presentation

(5, 4).clue: In 1986 Wole Soyinka made headlines as the first black recipient of this

(6, 4).clue: 2-word descriptive term for Mercury, Venus, Earth or Mars because of their orbits nearest the sun

(1, 5).clue: India is separated from this nation by the 40-mile-wide Palk Strait

(2, 5).clue: In 2003 he became the first Canadian since Ferguson Jenkins 32 years earlier to win the National League Cy Young Award
(2, 5).correct response: Eric Gagne (of the Los Angeles Dodgers)

(3, 5).clue: In 1531 Diego de Ordaz set out to explore this Venezuelan river

(4, 5).clue: Tuna, olives & hard-boiled eggs are ingredients in the salad made in this style named for a city on the French Riviera

(5, 5).clue: In 1967 Odumegwu Ojukwu declared this region independent of Nigeria, leading to a disasterous civil war

(6, 5).clue: The travel guidebooks from this company promise "Down-to-Earth Travel Information"

(0, 0).clue: The Time Almanac lists only the children from his 1772 marriage, but says there's DNA evidence of more
